alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 22 at 5:16AM PDT until May 26 at 12:58PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Rain on a primed snowpack along with warming daytime high temperatures will lead to melt increasing at times. Flows in rivers will oscillate and reach critical levels at times. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.7 feet, Water begins to impact State Route 21 near Little Goosemus Road at mile post 185. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM PDT Monday the stage was 18.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 19.7 feet Wednesday afternoon. It will fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.7 feet on 06/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 630 AM PDT.
